technical-data.invention-title: Procédé pour la fabrication d'une pale

description.p: The invention relates to a method to manufacture a blade, especially to manufacture a blade of a wind turbine.

A blade, like a blade of a wind turbine, is exposed to numerous environmental influences like ultraviolet light, rain, ice, hail and abrasion, which is originated by microparticles in the wind passing by. Even the wind, which is acting on the blade, causes mechanic loads at the blade.
The blade, especially the surface of the blade, has to withstand the impacts - thus the surface of the blade is treated and processed accordingly.
It is known to use a painting at the surface to deal with the impacts addressed above.

Preferably a coating is brought towards the blade-surface by help of a spray gun. The spray gun can be part of an automated painting process or may even be used as hand-held in a manual handwork-process. A compressed gas like air is used to direct paint particles to the blade surface. As a result an even coating of liquid is originated at the blade-surface.

However this method shows the disadvantage that the whole painting procedure is time consuming and requires separate painting facilities with ventilation, heating, ... etc. Thus the method is quite expensive in view to the costs.
It is also known to use a so called "gel-coat" to protect the surface of a blade, which is made of a composite material. The most common gel-coats comprise a "styrene-based" resin.

The gel-coat is liquid and is usually applied into a mould at a bottom layer. On top of the gel-coat additional layers of composite material, Balsa-wood, ..., etc. are arranged in a sandwich-structure to build up the blade. All layers are cured together by resin, which is applied into the mould and to the layers.
As a result of this method the visible surface of the composite or blade shows a high-quality finish.

However the styrene-based gel-coat has a very bad odur and even comprises a health-risk for the personnel, who handle the gel-coat during the manufacturing of the blade. As a result additional steps for the personnel-protection are needed while even the costs are rising.
Document DE 103 48 262 A1 describes a method to produce a coating of a surface.
It is therefore the aim of the invention, to provide an improved method and arrangement to manufacture a blade, which is less expensive and less critical in view to the environment.
This aim is reached by the features of claim 1.
Preferred configurations are object of the dependent claims.
According to the invention a blade is manufactured by help of a mould. A dry powder is applied like a coat to the inner surface of the mould.

The mould is arranged to be used later to build up the structure of the blade. Thus the mould carries different layers of blade-components, while the dry-powder-coat is the bottom layer of the blade-structure.

Next the components of the blade are arranged in layers on top of the dry-powder-coat and on top of the mould to build up the sandwich-structure of the blade. The blade is manufactured by help of a "Vacuum Assisted Resin Transfer Moulding, VARTM"-process.
Finally resin is applied to the mould and to the blade-components. When the resin cures out all sandwich-layers are connected.
The coat, which is originated or introduced by the dry powder, is established as blade-surface afterwards, for example after the blade-manufacturing-process.

Preferably the dry-powder is made of an amount of or even contains an amount of polymers like polyester, polyurethane, polyester-epoxy (which is also known as "hybrid"), straight epoxy (which is a so called "fusion bonded epoxy") and also acrylics. Even "styrene-based" dry-powder might be used.
The dry powder might be made of any material, which can serve as a blade-coating later to achieve a strong skin of the manufactured blade.
Preferably the material used allows an easy post-processing of the blade-skin if needed.
For example the material for the dry-powder might be chosen in a way that an optimized surface of the blade is generated for an additional painting.

The dry powder-coat is used as bottom layer within the mould. As the powder is dry there is no additional need to protect the personnel working asides the mould - no harmful solvent needs to be used any more in view to the prior art cited above.
Preferably the dry powder is applied by the use of an electro-statically field to the inner surface of the mould. Thus working-time is reduced and money is spared.

Preferably paint is employed or contained within the dry powder. The paint preferably contains powdered particles. The mixture of paint and powder is applied to the inner surface of the mould as described above to cover at least the inner surface of the mould.

Preferably an electrostatic field is used when the dry powder or mixture is applied to the mould. The electrostatic field is applied in a way that an even distribution of the powder / mixture asides at least the inner surface of the mould is achieved.
Preferably at least the inner surface of the mould is electrically connected with the "earth".
Due to the electrostatic field the powder / mixture is accelerated towards the mould. The whole method is quite clean as no powder or mixture is wasted.
Preferably surplus dry powder is gathered for a reuse within the method. Thus the method is quite economical in view to the material usage.
Preferably the powder / mixture is projected towards the mould by a spray-method.
Preferably an electrostatic gun or a corona gun is used for this purpose.
Preferably additional powder-coatings are applied stepwise to reach a pre-determined thickness. Thus a quite thick resulting coating is reached.

Preferably the dry powder / mixture is heated for its curing. Due to the heat the powder / mixture is liquefied, thus even complicated structures of the inner mould-surface can be covered by the fluid. When the fluid consolidates a hard surface of the manufactured blade is achieved. Thus a strong and well processable skin of the blade is gained.
The heat is applied to the mould.
Preferably the heat is applied before the resin is provided to the blade-structure (the resin is provided by using the "Vacuum Assisted Resin Transfer Moulding, VARTM"-process).
It is even possible to use at least a part of the heat, which is released while the resin cures out.
The invention is shown in more detail by help of FIG 1.
A mould 2, which is used to build up the structure of a blade, is electrical neutral coupled with the ground.
An electrostatic gun 1 is used to spray dry-powder 5 towards the mould 2.
The electrostatic gun 1 is connected with a line 3, which is used to provide at least the dry-powder to the gun 1.
Preferably (but not shown in detail here) paint is provided additionally as powdered particles to the dry-powder.
The electrostatic gun 1 is also connected with a line 4, which is used to produce an electrostatic field.

After the powder-applying-process layers of the blade-components (like composite material, glass fiber material, Balsa-wood, ..., etc.) is laid up in the mould to get the three-dimensional structure of the blade. This is done according to a "Vacuum Assisted Resin Transfer Moulding, VARTM"-process to get the blade-structure.
The mould and thus the applied dry-powder are heated. The powder is liquefied by the heat. Thus even complicated structures of the inner mould-surface are covered by the liquefied powder.
The liquefied powder consolidates and a hard surface for the blade is achieved.
Preferably the heat is applied to the mould before the resin is provided to the blade-structure. The resin may be provided by using the VARTM-process.
It is even possible to use at least a part of the heat, which is released due to the curing of the resin.
As a summary dry-powder is brought as a coating to the surface of a mould before other components (like composite material, glass fibers, etc.) is arranged onto the mould.
The powder-coat creates a hard finish, which is tougher than conventional painting.
The powder-coat emits no or nearly no volatile organic compounds, which in turn is environmentally safe.
A powder-coating-overspray can be recycled if the "wasted"-powder is gathered by appropriate means. Thus it is possible to achieve a nearly 100 % usage of the coating powder-material.
A further advantage is that powder-coated-items have generally fewer appearance-differences between horizontally coated surfaces and vertically coated surfaces than liquid coated items.

claim.claim-text: Verfahren zur Herstellung eines Rotorblattes, - wobei eine Form bereitgestellt wird und verwendet wird, um Schichten von Rotorblattkomponenten zu tragen, - wobei ein Trockenpulver wenigstens auf eine Innenfläche der Form aufgebracht wird, bevor die Schichten auf der Innenfläche der Form angeordnet werden, sodass die Form eine Trockenpulverbeschichtung als eine untere Schicht umfasst, - wobei Komponenten des Rotorblattes in Schichten auf der Trockenpulverbeschichtung angeordnet werden, um eine Sandwichstruktur des Rotorblattes aufzubauen, - wobei der Form Wärme zugeführt wird, um das Trockenpulver zu verflüssigen, - wobei das Rotorblatt mithilfe eines "vakuumunterstützten Harzinfusionsprozesses" (VARTM) hergestellt wird, sodass Harz auf die Form und auf die Rotorblattkomponenten aufgebracht wird, um alle Sandwich-Schichten zu verbinden, während das Harz aushärtet, und - wobei sich das verflüssigte Pulver verfestigt, um eine harte Oberfläche des hergestellten Rotorblattes zu erzielen.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 1, wobei das Trockenpulver für eine gleichmäßige Verteilung des Pulvers mithilfe eines elektrostatischen Feldes auf die Innenfläche der Form aufgebracht wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1 oder Anspruch 2, wobei das Trockenpulver für seine Aushärtung auf eine Weise erwärmt wird, dass das Trockenpulver verflüssigt wird und Strukturen der Innenfläche der Form bedeckt.

Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3, - wobei Farbe dem Trockenpulver als trockene pulverisierte Partikel zugegeben wird, und - wobei die Mischung von Farbe und Pulver auf die Innenfläche der Form aufgebracht wird.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Mischung für ihre Aushärtung auf eine Weise erwärmt wird, dass die Mischung verflüssigt wird und Strukturen der Innenfläche der Form bedeckt.
Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 5, wobei mindestens die Innenfläche der Form für eine gleichmäßige Verteilung des Pulvers oder der Mischung mit der elektrischen Masse verbunden ist.
Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 6, wobei zusätzliche Beschichtungen aus Trockenpulver oder Mischung stufenweise aufgebracht werden, um eine dicke resultierende Beschichtung herzustellen.
Verfahren nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei das Trockenpulver eine Menge an Polymeren wie Polyester, Polyurethan, Polyester-Epoxid, reines Epoxid oder Acryle enthält.
Verfahren nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Wärme zugeführt wird, bevor das Harz der Rotorblattstruktur zugeführt wird.
Verfahren nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei ein Teil der Wärme, welche freigesetzt wird, während das Harz aushärtet, verwendet wird, um das Pulver zu verflüssigen.

Method to manufacture a blade, - wherein a mould is provided and used to carry layers of blade-components, - wherein a dry-powder is applied at least to an inner surface of the mould, before the layers are arranged onto the inner surface of the mould, thus the mould comprises a dry powder-coat as a bottom layer, - wherein components of the blade are arranged in layers on top of the dry-powder-coat to build up a sandwich-structure of the blade, - wherein heat is applied to the mould to liquefy the dry-powder, - wherein the blade is manufactured by help of a "Vacuum Assisted Resin Transfer Moulding, VARTM"-process, thus resin is applied to the mould and to the blade-components to connect all sandwich-layers while the resin cures out, and - wherein the liquefied powder consolidates to achieve a hard surface of the blade manufactured.
Method according to claim 1, wherein the dry-powder is applied by the help of an electrostatic-field to the inner surface of the mould for an even distribution of the powder.
Method according to claim 1 or to claim 2, wherein the dry-powder is heated for its curing in a way that the dry-powder is liquefied and covers structures of the inner mould-surface.

Method according to one of the claims 1 to 3, - wherein paint is employed to the dry powder as dry powdered particles, and - wherein the mixture of paint and powder is applied to the inner surface of the mould.
Method according to claim 4, wherein the mixture is heated for its curing in a way that the mixture is liquefied and covers structures of the inner mould-surface.
Method according to one of the claims 1 to 5, wherein at least the inner surface of the mould is connected with the electrical ground for an even distribution of the powder or mixture.
Method according to one of the claims 1 to 6, wherein additional coatings of dry-powder or mixture are applied stepwise for a thick resulting coating.
Method according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the dry powder contains an amount of polymers like polyester, polyurethane, polyester-epoxy, straight epoxy or acrylics.
Method according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the heat is applied before the resin is provided to the blade-structure.

Method according to one of the preceding claims, -
wherein a part of the heat, which is released while the resin cures out, is used to liquefy the powder.

Procédé de fabrication d'une pale, - dans lequel un moule est fourni et utilisé pour contenir des couches de composants de pale, - dans lequel une poudre sèche est appliquée au moins sur une surface intérieure du moule, avant que les couches ne soient disposées sur la surface intérieure du moule, le moule comprenant ainsi un revêtement de poudre sèche en tant que couche de fond, - dans lequel les composants de la pale sont disposés en couches par-dessus le revêtement de poudre sèche pour constituer une structure en sandwich de la pale, - dans lequel de la chaleur est appliquée au moule afin de liquéfier la poudre sèche, - dans lequel la pale est fabriquée à l'aide d'un procédé de "moulage par transfert de résine sous vide, VARTM", de la résine est ainsi appliquée sur le moule et sur les composants de pale afin de relier toutes les couches en sandwich lorsque la résine durcit, et - dans lequel la poudre liquéfiée se consolide pour obtenir une surface dure de la pale fabriquée.
Procédé selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la poudre sèche est appliquée à l'aide d'un champ électrostatique sur la surface intérieure du moule pour une répartition homogène de la poudre.

Procédé selon la revendication 1 ou la revendication 2, dans lequel la poudre sèche est chauffée pour son durcissement de sorte que la poudre sèche est liquéfiée et recouvre les structures de la surface intérieure du moule.

Procédé selon l'une des revendications 1 à 3, - dans lequel de la peinture est utilisée dans la poudre sèche sous forme de particules pulvérulentes sèches, et - dans lequel le mélange de peinture et de poudre est appliqué sur la surface intérieure du moule.
Procédé selon la revendication 4, dans lequel le mélange est chauffé pour son durcissement de sorte que le mélange est liquéfié et recouvre les structures de la surface intérieure du moule.
Procédé selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 5, dans lequel au moins la surface intérieure du moule est reliée à la masse électrique pour une répartition uniforme de la poudre ou du mélange.
Procédé selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 6, dans lequel des revêtements supplémentaires de poudre sèche ou de mélange sont appliqués par étapes pour obtenir un revêtement épais.

Procédé selon l'une des revendications précédentes, dans lequel la poudre sèche contient une quantité de polymères comme le polyester, le polyuréthane, le polyester-époxy, l'époxy lié par fusion ou l'acrylique.
Procédé selon l'une des revendications précédentes, dans lequel la chaleur est appliquée avant que la résine ne soit fournie sur la structure de pale.
Procédé selon l'une des revendications précédentes, dans lequel une partie de la chaleur qui est libérée pendant que la résine durcit est utilisée pour liquéfier la poudre.
